proscene
Class PSConstraint

java.lang.Object
  proscene.PSConstraint
Direct Known Subclasses:
PSAxisPlaneConstraint
public class PSConstraint
extends java.lang.Object

An interface class for Frame constraints.

This class defines the interface for the PSConstraints that can be applied to a PSFrame to limit its motion. Use PSFrame.setConstraint(PSConstraint) to associate a PSConstraint to a PSFrame (default is a null PSFrame.constraint().

PSConstraint

Method Detail

constrainTranslation

public processing.core.PVector constrainTranslation(processing.core.PVector translation,
                                                    PSFrame frame)
Filters the translation applied to the PSframe. This default implementation is empty (no filtering).

Overload this method in your own PSConstraint class to define a new translation constraint. frame is the PSFrame to which is applied the translation. Use its PSFrame.position() and update the translation accordingly instead.

translation is expressed in the local PSFrame coordinate system. Use PSFrame.inverseTransformOf(PVector) to express it in the world coordinate system if needed.

constrainRotation

public PSQuaternion constrainRotation(PSQuaternion rotation,
                                      PSFrame frame)
Filters the rotation applied to the frame. This default implementation is empty (no filtering).

Overload this method in your own PSConstraint class to define a new rotation constraint. See constrainTranslation(PVector, PSFrame) for details.

Use PSFrame.inverseTransformOf(PVector) on the rotation PSQuaternion.axis() to express rotation in the world coordinate system if needed.
